newsitem.title: USA: U.S. mortgage-backeds move upward late Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: U.S. mortgage-backeds move upward late Wednesday.

text.p: U.S. mortgage-backed securities drifted lazily upward with Treasuries on Wednesday, ending a string of light losses.
"The market's moving around here a little bit, but there's not a lot trading," one New York trader said.
Mortgages held largely unchanged much of the day but broke out of their rut at about 1500EDT/1900GMT.

Treasuries perked up after Wednesday's five-year note auction, sparking the small rise in mortgages, traders said. Relief the week's supply was over, along with rumors of Fed buying, helped bolster Treasuries, goverments traders said.
Pass-throughs' spreads over Treasuries had widened slightly by late on Wednesday afternoon.

Ginnie Mae 30-year 7.5 percent coupons were up 3/32 at 99-14/32, yielding 109 basis points over the 10-year Treasury note. Comparable Fannie Mae paper was up 2/32 at 99/15-32, and Freddie Mac current coupons were up 3/32 at 99-17/32.
The 10-year Treasury note had climbed 4/32 to 99-19/32, yielding 6.56 percent.
